ygData.subject: RE: Re: Mid-level songs
ygData.msgSnippet: Mobs do change levels and acquire new skills if they raise high enough. Also it may have had spirit sight cast on it by another nearby mob. Aside from this I
ygData.messageBody:
Mobs do change levels and acquire new skills if they raise high enough. Also
it may have had spirit sight cast on it by another nearby mob. Aside from
this I know some Undead see invis just fine whil others not at all. I have
had Festering hags not see me if they are green to me, and then a blue one
sees me and scowls. I have walked all the way into the ghost room unmolested
and other times a greater skel or hag will see me. In lower guk all the
ghouls see invis just fine, while in upper all that can see me is the Warden
and the Lord. I never trust past experience with invis in any area I dont
know as gospel. Unrest is one of those places you never know whats going to
happen next, I dont care how long you have played there.

-----Original Message-----
From: John Kim [mailto:kim@...]
Sent: Thursday, August 26, 1999 8:48 AM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Re: Mid-level songs


From: John Kim <kim@...>

On Thu, 26 Aug 1999, Talies the Wanderer wrote:
> At 08:23 PM 8/25/99 -0400, you wrote:
> >
> >Almost every time I think something saw through my
> >invisibility, I scroll back and the message immediately before
> >I was attacked is "you become visible."
>
> Hrm - there has always been some error with the cause and effect timing.
> Notice how whenever you are bashed, your song ends *before* the monster
> bashes you? Methinks that they hit you, removing the invisibility. Now
> how they saw you - well, who knows?

Well, unless you can explain how a mob that I'd safely walked
through a dozen times before while invisible could suddenly
see me, I will go with the invisibility blinking off as the
explanation. :-)

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
